meanings.definition: To adjust or rearrange in a new way.
meanings.sent1: I need to rejigger my schedule to fit in the new class.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rejigger the furniture layout in her room.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rejigger the puzzle pieces was more challenging than expected.
meanings.sent4: He managed to rejigger the broken clock to make it work again.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his wand to rejigger the deck of cards into a perfect order.

meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to rejigger the engine to fix the problem.
meanings.sent2: She tried to rejigger the recipe by adding more spices.
meanings.sent3: The kids attempted to rejigger the rules of the game to their advantage.
meanings.sent4: He had to rejigger his presentation at the last minute due to new information.
meanings.sent5: The scientist needed to rejigger the experiment setup for accurate results.

meanings.sent1: Grandpa likes to rejigger with old radios to make them work again.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys rejiggering with different art techniques to create unique pieces.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to rejigger with the yarn, causing a mess in the room.
meanings.sent4: He tends to rejigger with his computer settings, often causing issues.
meanings.sent5: The inventor would often rejigger with his inventions until they were perfect.
